intro: Capsella hiatula, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or mouse-ear cress, is a small annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other economically important plants such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, with small, heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its seeds are enclosed in a siliqua, a type of dry fruit characteristic of the Brassicaceae family. Capsella hiatula is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
